{%trans%}Type \(\mathrm{A}_n\){%endtrans%}

{%trans%} Throughtout \((W,\mathbb{S})\) will denote an irreducible Coxeter system of type \(\mathrm{A}_n\). We will also denote by (\Phi\) a root system whose associated reflection group is \(W\) and by \(\Delta \subset \Phi^+ \subset \Phi\) a set of simple and positive roots respectively. {%endtrans%}

{%trans%}The Weyl Group and Root System{%endtrans%}

{%trans%} \(W\) {%endtrans%}

{%trans%} The symmetric group \(\mathfrak{S}_{n+1}\) {%endtrans%}

{%trans%} \(\mathbb{S}\) {%endtrans%}

{%trans%} Basic transpositions \(\{(1,2),\dots,(n,n+1)\}\) {%endtrans%}

{%trans%} \(\Phi\) {%endtrans%}

{%trans%} Let \(V \subseteq \mathbb{R}^{n+1}\) be the subspace {%endtrans%}

\[ \{(x_1,\dots,x_n) \mid x_1+\cdots+x_n = 0\} \]

{%trans%} Assuming \(\{e_1,\dots,e_n\}\) is the standard basis of \(\mathbb{R}^{n+1}\) then {%endtrans%}

\[ \Phi = \{e_i - e_j \mid i \neq j, 1 \leqslant i,j \leqslant n+1\} \]

{%trans%} \(\Phi^+\) {%endtrans%}

{%trans%} \( \{e_i - e_j \mid 1 \leqslant i < j \leqslant n+1\} \) {%endtrans%}

{%trans%} \(\Delta\) {%endtrans%}

{%trans%} \( \{e_1 - e_2,\dots, e_n - e_{n+1}\} \) {%endtrans%}

{%trans%}Conjugacy Classes of \(W\){%endtrans%}

{%trans%} The conjugacy classes of the symmetric group \(\mathfrak{S}_{n+1}\) are naturally labelled by the partitions of \(n+1\) (see 1.2 of [JK81]). {%endtrans%}
